figure_captions.caption: Unenhanced chest CT images in a 45-year-old woman with 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) pneumonia. (a) Coronal CT scan shows multiple bilateral areas of consolidation with some central low attenuation suggesting an organizing pneumonia pattern. (b) Axial image shows the right lower lobe organizing pneumonia and an early crazy-paving pattern in the left lower lobe. (c) CT coronal reformation obtained 2 days later shows that the bilateral consolidations have increased in CT value. (d) Corresponding axial CT scan shows that the crazy-paving pattern has resolved

Unenhanced chest CT images in a 32-year-old man with 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) pneumonia. (a) CT scan shows a right lower lobe subpleural consolidation. (b) CT scan obtained 3 days later shows that the right lower lobe consolidation has evolved into more of an organizing pneumonia pattern. (c) CT scan obtained after 8 days of therapy shows near-complete resolution of the right lower lobe airspace disease

summary: A 45-year-old woman living in Wuhan, China, was admit- Real-time fluorescence polymerase chain reaction of the ted to the hospital for 2 days due to cough and fever.
From the 2019-nCoV Investigating and Research Team, Department of Radiology, Affiliated Taizhou Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University, 150 Ximen Street, Linhai, 317000, Zhejiang Province, China.
The authors report two cases of 2019 novel coronavirus increased neutrophil ratio (81.2%; normal range, 40.0%– (2019-nCoV).
Both patients are believed to have ex- 75.0%), decreased lymphocyte ratio (12.8%; normal posure related to Wuhan, China (1–4).
20.0%–50.0%), increased erythrocyte sedimentachange in the course of disease over time on CT scans (5,6).
D-dimer concentration, and increased lymphokine interleukin 6 (27.47 pg/mL; normal range, 0.1–2.9 pg/mL).
On patient’s sputum was positive for the 2019-nCoV nucleic admission, her body temperature was elevated (38.2°C acid.
Unenhanced chest CT showed multiple bilateral ar-
[100.76°F]) and there were coarse breath sounds of both eas of peripheral consolidation (Fig 1a, 1b).
Her laboratory studies showed an terlobular septal thickening with a crazy paving appearance
This copy is for personal use only.
Contact reprints@rsna.org
The adjacent pleura was thickened, without mediastinal lymphadenopathy or pleural fluid.
The patient’s temperature rose to 39.2°C (102.56°F) and constitutional symptoms worsened.
Repeat chest CT showed progressive consolidation with loss of the areas of crazy paving (Fig 1c, 1d).
After antiviral and symptomatic treatment, the patient remains under close observation with improvement in symptoms.
A 32-year-old man had a history of business travel to Wuhan, China.
His body temperature was slightly elevated (38.1°C [100.58°F]) and coarse breath sounds of both lungs were found at auscultation.
Laboratory studies showed normal complete blood count values, normal C-reactive protein, and normal Ddimer concentration.
The lymphokine interleukin 6 level was increased (413.6 pg/mL; normal range, 0.1–2.9 pg/mL).
Realtime fluorescence polymerase chain reaction of the patient’s sputum was positive for 2019-nCoV nucleic acid.
Unenhanced chest CT showed subpleural right lower lobe consolidation (Fig 2a).
There was bronchiectasis with reactive thickening of the adjacent pleura.
After 3 days of antiviral and symptomatic treatment, the right lower lobe consolidation increased (Fig 2b).
Repeat chest CT 8 days later (Fig 2c) showed improvement.
Disclosures of Conflicts of Interest: Y.F. disclosed no relevant relationships.
W.J. disclosed no relevant relationships.

The adjacent pleura was thickened, without mediastinal lymphadenopathy or pleural fluid.
The patient’s temperature rose to 39.2°C (102.56°F) and constitutional symptoms worsened.
Repeat chest CT showed progressive consolidation with loss of the areas of crazy paving (Fig 1c, 1d).
After antiviral and symptomatic treatment, the patient remains under close observation with improvement in symptoms.
A 32-year-old man had a history of business travel to Wuhan, China.
His body temperature was slightly elevated (38.1°C [100.58°F]) and coarse breath sounds of both lungs were found at auscultation.
Laboratory studies showed normal complete blood count values, normal C-reactive protein, and normal Ddimer concentration.
The lymphokine interleukin 6 level was increased (413.6 pg/mL; normal range, 0.1–2.9 pg/mL).
Realtime fluorescence polymerase chain reaction of the patient’s sputum was positive for 2019-nCoV nucleic acid.
Unenhanced chest CT showed subpleural right lower lobe consolidation (Fig 2a).
Conclusion: There was bronchiectasis with reactive thickening of the adjacent pleura.
After 3 days of antiviral and symptomatic treatment, the right lower lobe consolidation increased (Fig 2b).
Repeat chest CT 8 days later (Fig 2c) showed improvement.
